column1: Why are Republicans more focused on engaging Trump’s lies about the election than on giving people the relief they need? The election is over and we’re in the middle of the worst crisis in a century. Let’s put our country’s needs first.

In just over a month 13M Americans will lose unemployment benefits leaving them unable to afford food or necessities. We need comprehensive relief now: a full extension to enhanced unemployment student debt relief $2000 to everyone until this crisis is over and more. https://t.co/47tDLC1G1I

As the richest country in the world we are letting so many of our people down. Giving people $2000/month would relieve food insecurity for millions of families.  Why are we stalling while more than 10% of people aren't sure when their next meal will be? https://t.co/1teuPeM6gn

Last week 778000 Americans filed for unemployment. That means tens of thousands of Americans are newly without health care in the middle of a pandemic that’s getting worse everyday.  We need Medicare for All more than ever.

During the biggest crisis we've seen in a century billionaires became $1 trillion richer. Right now they have more than 2x as much wealth as the bottom 50% of Americans.  We can afford student debt relief free public college and a higher minimum wage. https://t.co/VfHrQEnc6T

It's time for America to realize the same thing that most of our international peers recognized a long time ago: low-cost higher education benefits everyone. Forgiving student debt and investing in our educational system have to become top priorities for our future.

We’re facing an unprecedented hunger crisis in America. 26 million people or 1 in 8 Americans are going hungry. In the richest nation in the world that’s unconscionable.   Congress has the power to address this crisis. Why aren’t we doing it? https://t.co/us7aikA1h9
Wishing everyone a happy Thanksgiving today. It’s been a difficult year and we’re all celebrating a little differently but hope you're all staying safe and reflecting on what you're thankful for.

✅ Ongoing PPE shortage in the worst wave of the pandemic yet ✅ Americans still waiting on a second relief package ✅ Commonsense measures like mask wearing still politicized  It’s long past time for comprehensive action on COVID-19. Let’s get to work.

During this pandemic Yemen has evolved into the biggest humanitarian crisis in the world.  We have an opportunity to reshape America's foreign policy and role on the global stage—and we must make ending the war in Yemen a top priority in that process.
The Senate managed to pass a SCOTUS nominee in 30 days but can’t pass any meaningful relief for Americans?

For the millions of Americans who have been left behind during the pandemic $2000 a month isn't a "handout." It's diapers for their children it's food on the table it's the heating bill. We have the power to help and we need to use it.

College costs have skyrocketed while incomes have remained nearly stagnant. It’s no wonder how we’ve reached this point.  The student debt crisis is preventing millions from having savings owning a home starting a business and more. It’s long past time for comprehensive relief. https://t.co/iXJYgg4koR

@thechrisbuskirk @wrenhunter We need to extend the wealth generation of the digital economy to rural communities and places left behind and develop an agenda to make sure America not China leads the tech of the future. This can be bipartisan.

The brilliant framing in this piece is that it is deindustrialization & an unfettered market that is costing jobs not government policy. The government is part of the solution to diversify the economy & create regional jobs. We should be crushing Republicans on a jobs message. https://t.co/A13rSu48Cj
America's pandemic response so far has prioritized corporations and stock markets over human lives. We have to radically reevaluate where our money is going during the largest disaster in a century.

.@ABlinken is an honorable and thoughtful public servant who was helpful during our work to end the war in Yemen. He has always been open to engaging progressives. I look forward to working with him to bring an end to the worst humanitarian catastrophe in modern times. https://t.co/qSotkFxICz

.@LindaT_G is an inspired choice. It is refreshing to see the post go to a dedicated foreign service officer as opposed to someone simply with political connections big money behind them or celebrity. She will represent us in a way that makes me proud of our nation. https://t.co/ofOl3u9SZD
As we push for climate change policies these next four years let us remember that nothing is as environmentally devastating as war.

This is an outstanding vision @billpeduto @YtownTitoBrown @nanwhaley @MayorGinther @JohnCranley @HuntingtonMayor Ron Dulaney Jr. and @louisvillemayor. This should be a top priority in the first 100 days.  https://t.co/5qJty6hgSL

We need an eviction moratorium. We need rental assistance. But we can’t stop there if we’re going to support people through the worst wave of the pandemic yet. We need a fresh source of security for Americans in need: $2000/month. https://t.co/CM2uoCZvk4
@bonojd Yes he did David. And I give him credit for that. But trails senior cabinet roles matter in their worldview
We have to distribute the COVID-19 vaccine for free to everyone as soon as it’s ready.

Flournoy supported the war in Iraq & Libya criticized Obama on Syria and helped craft the surge in Afghanistan. I want to support the President’s picks. But will Flournoy now commit to a full withdrawal from Afghanistan & a ban on arms sales to the Saudis to end the Yemen war?

33 million Americans are living in financial limbo because of student debt and continuing to pause payments is not a permanent solution. We need comprehensive student debt relief and we need it now.  https://t.co/V95AOFmAs9
There is no economic recovery without efforts to get the pandemic under control. Period.

Enhanced unemployment benefits saved millions of Americans. After they ended 7 million people fell into poverty.  Since then we’ve done nothing to help people get through this crisis. We need to extend assistance to the American people now. https://t.co/eEOEgRgoza

15 to 16 million of America’s most vulnerable children are missing vital parts of their education right now because they don’t have adequate internet access. They deserve so much better from us. Broadband for all isn’t just policy it’s an urgent humanitarian need.

America needs a plan to distribute the COVID-19 vaccine the moment it’s safely available. We have to use the Defense Production Act to prepare for this enormous production effort.  https://t.co/62KZIw9BJE

In just one month from September to October the number of Americans saying they were struggling to pay for household expenses rose by over 2 million to 34.8 million.  It’s unconscionable that Congress left without passing a relief bill. People need help now.

There are retired people in America who are so mired in student debt that we are garnishing their Social Security checks to keep up their payments.  This is not just a young person's problem. Student debt relief will improve life for people in all corners of America.

Over 11 million people have contracted COVID-19 in America. More than 250000 people are dead. We are facing the biggest disaster of this century and it’s long past time we invested in protecting our people and in a concrete plan for contact tracing.

The issue is not whether GDP or consumer spending recovers. It’s whether wealth inequality continues to soar with low-wage employment. It would be a colossal blunder to forgo bold progressive policy & bet the farm on good macro statistics. https://t.co/Cc6ItevGgF

Ordering people with COVID-19 to continue working is not just dangerous and against all scientific advice it is a violation of dignity for every essential worker. We need universal sick leave and guaranteed safety protections now more than ever. https://t.co/0U9cNSIJws

.@BLeeForCongress would be an incredible pick for the Senate. I have always said she’s a profile in courage with her stance against military interventions. She would have my complete support and is a mentor. What is important is that the pick be a strong progressive. https://t.co/Ay6RBvRuxK

This #TransDayOfRemembrance we remember the more than 30 trans and gender non-conforming lives mostly Black and Brown trans women that have been lost to bigotry and violence. It has to end.  Let's honor their lives by continuing to fight for justice and equality.
If you missed this you can watch the conversation on the link.

Tune in tonight to hear @ninaturner & @TulsiGabbard who have both stood up against bad wars for Medicare for all and for bold policies to tackle climate change. They both were at the forefront of the Sanders 2016 effort! Congrats to @ninaturner on the podcast’s success! https://t.co/ZlDx3sEn8M

Proud to stand with @sunrisemvmt and my progressive colleagues to demand a Green New Deal today.  We must take bold action on climate change. Our future depends on it. Young people across the nation are watching closely. https://t.co/r7Z3xwt65f https://t.co/0y6axkUeHt

An estimated 205 million Americans are at risk of utility shut offs right now. Nearly two-thirds of the country. That’s staggering.   We need to put money in people’s pockets so they can pay their bills: $2000/month.
Why is our Senate getting paid to not pass a relief bill that would help millions of Americans economically recover?

Right now the top financial concern for most Americans is keeping up with their bills.  The last time that was the case? 2012.   People need relief. Let's put $2000 into the pockets of ordinary Americans every month until this crisis is over. https://t.co/F9tpaXZqKg
If the American people were a corporation Republicans would've stopped playing politics and passed a relief bill months ago.

In this middle of this pandemic over 42 million Americans lack access to broadband. They can’t work from home learn from home or virtually see loved ones. Now more than ever we must invest in our people by expanding broadband to every community. https://t.co/c1F67iUvST

The American people agree: we need a $15 minimum wage. It’d lift over 1 million people out of poverty and impact 25% of Black workers.  The fight for a living wage needs to be a top priority.  https://t.co/LPW6OueV0k

It's not enough for tech companies to say Black Lives Matter—what's Silicon Valley actually doing about it?  It isn’t just about police violence it’s about ensuring Black children have a shot at the American Dream. Tech companies need to step up & address the racial wealth gap. https://t.co/Ofew7cVkA5

We’ve surpassed 10 million COVID-19 cases—that's 20% of the world’s entire cases.   This pandemic is spiraling out of control. We need immediate action to curb the spread of this virus now. https://t.co/D74qGUjd9B

.@cthagod asked why I’m so passionate about expanding Black opportunity in tech. Because without the civil rights movement my parents would’ve never been allowed here.  I want to stand up for a community that made my story possible. https://t.co/fQEMEDKCyV

A one-time stimulus check isn’t enough.   Millions of Americans continue to be forced into poverty during this pandemic. It’s time for us to provide immediate assistance—$2000/month for every struggling American for the duration of this crisis. https://t.co/ZraSz7n6RN
If Republicans can accept the House and Senate results they can accept President-elect Biden.
Wear a mask for yourself and others. https://t.co/vfiJp6dLyZ

In April we lifted 18 million Americans out of poverty with the CARES Act.  7 months later our economic crisis is far from over and the pandemic is deadlier than ever. It’s time for us to provide another lifeline for the American people.

One-third of voters said the economy was their top priority—and Trump won them by nearly 70%.  @BradBannon is right: to win big Democrats need to think big. We need a bold progressive economic message. https://t.co/d08ZveUcB3

Been reading @PeterBeinart’s terrific new newsletter. The new edition looks at why progressives aren’t shifting the Democrats’ foreign policy agenda as they’ve shifted its domestic agenda. Check it out https://t.co/ZKvIzT0qRM

A black woman has not won an elected to House Caucus Leadership since Shirley Chisholm. In 2020 we must change that. @RepRobinKelly is the obvious choice. I have worked with her on diversity in tech and progressive causes. Let’s finally break this ceiling.
This simple insight by @daveweigel is worth more than the entirety of our consultant class. https://t.co/6S78WDCWf9
@marwilliamson So admire your principled vision for peace and reconciliation in our nation and in the world.
@malcolmxrandal As I mentioned on Sharpton tonight on MSNBC I have tremendous admiration for Karen Bass and Barbara and would enthusiastically support either
@HeatherGautney Thank you for your incredible policy leadership.

@Redistrict .@Redistrict respect your work. Where was the turnout boost given Biden got the most votes ever? Was it all a swing or did certain younger voters or other groups turn out in larger numbers? Any evidence that the Floyd protests boosted turnout?

Well said @AndrewYang. We need a fund for independent local newspapers based on a tax on digital ad revenue. At some point people will figure out that grappling with the policy implications of the digital revolution is our most challenging task. https://t.co/MzJorXrRhB

GOP senators do not decide. ⁦@JoeBiden⁩ does. ⁦@ewarren⁩ & ⁦@BernieSanders⁩ are leaders of the progressive movement. They deserve a place. Biden should nominate them & dare Rs to break bipartisan tradition by voting no on qualified picks. https://t.co/CrLbgujAZO
@SayuBhojwani @IAImpactFund @KamalaHarris @RepBarbaraLee I love Barbara Lee! She’d be exceptional.

The USPS had a plan to distribute 650 million masks in April. Trump shot it down.  @BernieSanders and I introduced a bill to provide 3 high-quality masks to all back in July. No action.  There's still time to save lives. Congress must pass our Masks for All Act now. https://t.co/J4xvZVT9MD

10 million Americans are behind on rent or mortgage payments. Millions more are facing eviction and the CDC’s moratorium isn’t doing enough to protect them.  Let’s pass a real eviction moratorium rental assistance and provide monthly assistance to the American people.

This #VeteransDay let’s not just honor all of our veterans who risked their lives to serve our country but commit to giving them the support they need back home.   We need to provide health care mental health resources housing job opportunities and more to our veterans.

Trump’s failure to lead during this pandemic cost up to 210000 lives. Our current death toll is over 240000.  We’re looking ahead to dark times if we don’t start listening to the science and working to contain this virus.

Billionaires are almost $1T richer than they were at the start of this pandemic. Meanwhile:  🍲 22M Americans don't have enough to eat 🏥 12M have lost their health care 🏠 15% of renters are behind on their rent  When will McConnell stop blocking relief for ordinary Americans?

My brother a former AUSA and I have seen firsthand the inequalities in our justice system.  After the election and historic efforts to combat systemic racism it’s time to set a national example.  We need a DOJ committed to addressing racial inequality. https://t.co/vvCQEnwAGy
@thechrisbuskirk @SteveHiltonx @jaketapper Thanks for the kind comments @thechrisbuskirk. Looking forward to your book!
If we can find $95.8B to fund new nuclear missiles for the Pentagon imagine the relief we could provide to the American people.

The official unemployment numbers are underscoring the seriousness of this economic crisis.  54.6% of Americans aren't earning a living wage — including almost 60% of Black Americans.  People can't wait any longer. We need to pass an extensive relief bill now.

133 million Americans have a pre-existing condition. Their protections are at stake if the Supreme Court and its 3 Trump judges overturn the ACA. Health care for 21 million Americans is at stake.   We can’t let it happen.
@SteveHiltonx @jaketapper Our country needs a Douglass (Composite nation) or a Lincoln (Lyceum address). I have faith we will produce such leaders. America always has in times of crisis.

@SteveHiltonx @jaketapper What we are trying to do is very hard. There has never been a multiracial multiethnic democracy in the history of the world. Humility about our own blindspots and respect for the aspirations of those Americans who feel left out is essential for us to have any chance....

@SteveHiltonx @jaketapper Thank you @SteveHiltonx. I have always enjoyed your show and call for an optimistic and aspirational populism. I still believe a good jobs agenda focused on higher wages in communities left behind can perhaps start to stick back our democracy....
Because of the pandemic SCOTUS is meeting virtually to hear arguments on a case that could overturn the Affordable Care Act and take health coverage away from 21 million people during a pandemic.

I agree with @jaketapper. This is overboard & will not help us build a pluralistic democracy. I have worked with people like Matt Lira at the WH who built on Obama Admin efforts to modernize federal agencies. It would be absurd to blackball public servants like him. https://t.co/0RlGhlNQ4B
@Matt_Matros It was a live interview and I was trying to recall what I read. That’s why I wanted to clarify precisely.

The exit polls I discussed with @jonathanvswan took absentee voters into account. 83% to 17% for Trump for voters who prioritized the economy. We need a bold agenda delivering good jobs & higher wages for places left behind.  https://t.co/KgjleGyPQ6 https://t.co/4699TrTsRY

Congratulations to Progressive community activist @carroll_fife on being elected to the Oakland City Council.  You've shown that progressives win when they organize organize organize.  I'm proud to have endorsed you.
@ninaturner You’re such a sincere and true friend @ninaturner. Always doing and wishing for others
When Trump talks about our "great" economic recovery does he mean for billionaires?

Health experts warned us that our nation's daily cases would reach six digits. The White House did nothing.   Now this is our grim reality: one American is being infected every second. https://t.co/YTYwcSeqTX

With widespread mask wearing more than 100000 lives could be saved through February.   We can help prevent widespread devastation right now if Congress works to pass my bill with @BernieSanders to send 3 high-quality masks to every single American. Let’s get it done.
Joe Biden would not be President-elect if it were not for the Black Lives Matter movement and George Floyd protests. @BreeNewsome https://t.co/NPP80CRwjM
If North Dakota was a country it’d have the world’s highest rate of COVID-19 cases per capita.  We need to curb the spread of this virus now.

Love @esglaude phrase “budget your values.” Listen to @BreeNewsome explain how Black activists won the White House for us. There is a reason Black Americans despite all the suffering and injustice have been described as the conscience of our nation. https://t.co/wSCf8lrzCa
As Mitch McConnell holds up a relief bill for Americans Kentucky set a record for most new cases reported in a single day. https://t.co/78qJZn4E8G
Admire both of your work @BreeNewsome & @esglaude https://t.co/9nE82zi8NM

📅 14 weeks since full enhanced unemployment benefits ended 📅 7 months since $1200 stimulus checks first went out 📅 3 months since the PPP loans ended  Enough. We need action on a bold relief bill for everyday Americans now.
While the rich get richer over 8 million Americans have been forced into poverty since this pandemic began.  A relief bill can't wait. People need our help now. https://t.co/pHiy5FK9up

Voters made it clear: this country is ready to move past the disastrous War on Drugs.   It’s long past time to legalize marijuana at the federal level and repair the damage done to communities of color. https://t.co/jHxOF2Zabb

An all-time high.   We can’t forget that this pandemic is still raging. We have the power to try to contain COVID-19 and this administration is refusing to use it—this is the result. https://t.co/iuJW2EfmaU
One American is contracting COVID-19 every single second.   This didn’t have to happen.
Kasich says that debt and the solvency of social security and Medicare are the challenges facing America. That we need little steps. Honestly what century is he living in? https://t.co/QTsEHnuD0x

America has rejected Donald Trump. We’ve had enough of his failures during this pandemic his racism and his disregard for people's lives.  With @JoeBiden and @KamalaHarris in the White House we will usher in a new era of moral leadership that treats everyone with dignity.

✅  Marijuana legalization ✅  $15 minimum wage ✅  Paid family and medical leave ✅  Higher taxes on the wealthy  Progressive policies were winners all across the country this week from California to Arizona to Florida.   The American people agree with our economic message.
@M_T_Miller @PplsAction @fairfightaction @LUCHA_AZ @ConMijente Lots of credit to be shared and these groups were amazing!
@KujiChahal @jomalleydillon Thanks!

Biden’s win is much bigger than Trump in 16. His popular vote win will likely be bigger than Obama in 12 reaching up to 4%. @jomalleydillon and her team deserve huge credit for getting record turnout across the country and overcoming Trump’s voter surge & incumbency. Thank you.

How should House Democrats and Biden govern w McConnell? Pass $2000 month. Extend Medicare. Pass debt forgiveness & rent relief. Force McConnell to vote no and explain why. Ask for more before compromising with ourselves. Build public support before striking any deal.

Sat down with @jonathanvswan. In my four years in Congress he was one of the most prepared journalists in asking fair but hard & challenging questions. It was certainly not a puff interview but substantive. Country would benefit from a politics & journalism of real ideas.
Enjoyed it! https://t.co/Fx9WzBjdAN

Trump is filing baseless lawsuits over our elections as another 751K people filed for unemployment. Every day that passes without substantial relief for Americans is harming families all across the country. This needs to be a top priority starting now. https://t.co/CReLdo7epC

@NNUBonnie @RashidaTlaib @NationalNurses @CalNurses @SSWorks @PDAHCare @Public_Citizen @PNHPCalifornia @PNHP Thank you @NNUBonnie for your friendship and leadership. We will fight for Medicare for All until we achieve it.

@thechrisbuskirk I’d welcome that opportunity and working with you. I have worked with Rep Gallagher on some of these issues who is very thoughtful and would be great to do something on a bipartisan basis here.

I am a progressive on the Armed Serviced Committee. I completely agree with @thechrisbuskirk on this. Perhaps we can find common ground on an agenda to build our manufacturing base spread digital opportunity across our nation and ensure we lead in the technologies of the future https://t.co/Np6a2Jl8uO

Florida overwhelmingly voted to increase the state minimum wage to $15/hr.  A livable wage is proving not just necessary but popular all across the country. We have to keep pushing the #FightFor15 all the way up from the state level to the federal level. https://t.co/3Mx4ngmWIP

Progressive in the House will not stand by and watch the continual betrayal of American workers to appease the investor class. We will fight tooth and nail for a $15 wage bold infrastructure bill jobs program free college & vocational school and Medicare for All. https://t.co/iJ0EswuxGL
The president doesn’t just declare a winner—the voters do. As with every prior election we’re going to take the time we need to count every vote.

@AndrewFiggy And tech can be a connective tissue enabling some marginalized voices to find alternatives and enabling common work and prosperity. I’d love to send you a copy when it comes out next year!

@AndrewFiggy While I love my job I appreciate the kind words. I have a book coming out on dignity in the digital age where I advance my idea of interconnected communitarianism. The hope is that we can bring jobs to communities allowing them to keep their unique culture...
@ToferH @JoeBiden Just FYI. I have written opeds also with Ambassador McFaul on Russian disinformation and election interference. https://t.co/DoRDeczt31

This election is a sobering reminder of how divided we are as a nation and the giant task political leaders have to regain the trust of people & places left behind. We owe it to them to get behind a bold jobs and economic agenda to deliver for working families in a digital age.

.@GeorgeGascon’s victory shows us the people of Los Angeles want a fair and just system that works for everyone. I look forward to seeing him end mass incarceration and better the LA community with his unfaltering values.

Don’t let this news get lost: the Trump Administration officially left the Paris Agreement today.  No matter what happens climate change remains an existential threat facing humanity. We need to act like it at every level. https://t.co/YyMJ4DthBc
Over 160 million Americans cast votes in this election. We are going to count every single one.

.@CaptMarkKelly's campaign was fueled by Arizonans—not corporate PACs.  I continue to be inspired by his story values and leadership. In the Senate I know he’ll be a strong voice for protecting Medicare expanding health care and finally accomplishing common sense gun control.

Our movement continues to grow.  @Marie4Congress @TeresaForNM @JamaalBowmanNY @MondaireJones and @CoriBush are going to Congress.  Together we are going to build a progressive future where nobody is left behind.

We had a 77% win tonight. I am so honored to have such strong support and want to thank everyone in my district. I also want to thank Ritesh Tandon for a spirited race and hope we can bring the community together.
Congrats @Hickenlooper on the victory tonight! Looking forward to working with you on supporting small businesses during this pandemic and creating good-paying jobs all across this nation.

This is the most important election of our lifetime. If you haven't voted yet polls are open for two more hours!  The entire future of our nation is on the line.  Remember that CA has same day registration! Find your polling location and go vote now: https://t.co/grXsdKYYlw https://t.co/lkh2zDu99a
#ElectionDay should be a national holiday.

There is so much on the line today. Every single American must be able to vote safely.  If you witness intimidation or any other suspicious activities at your polling location please record it and call 1-866-OUR-VOTE right away to report it. #ElectionDay
Every vote must be counted. This shouldn’t be controversial. #ElectionDay
Wear a mask.  Practice social distancing.  Vote for a Congress that will take decisive action to contain this pandemic and help ordinary Americans. #ElectionDay

Today is the big day. Polls are open in California!  If you haven't yet please take some time today to vote or drop off your ballot by 8pm.  Not registered? California has same day voter registration!  You can find your nearest voting location here: https://t.co/grXsdKHmWW https://t.co/KGjMNVvLIT

China Pakistan Nigeria and Japan have a population of 1.9 billion people.  North and South Dakota have a population of just 1.6 million.  The Dakotas had more new COVID cases yesterday than those four countries combined.  Trump has clearly failed America. Vote him out.

Every elected official regardless of party should echo one message in the days ahead. No violence from anyone on any side. Too much blood has been spilled by too many Americans for our democracy. Let’s honor them and be worthy of being American citizens.

Brilliant appearance by @JohnFetterman. He is one of our rising stars. Please watch this clip and go and bank your vote today if you live in Pennsylvania.  My parents who live in Bucks County voted last week. Every vote will matter. https://t.co/kisjwDU39S

Attacking @sonipaul for her journalism is equivalent to Trump’s attacks on the free press. She actually understands the philosophy of Gandhi the Gita and the Vedas more than the fringe groups who launch attacks based on prejudice. https://t.co/jKa54hnd54

Trump has pulled out of two nuclear treaties and put us on the brink of war.  Our next president must take concrete steps to cut spending on nuclear arms extend treaties limit strategic missile defenses and push for diplomacy. @JerryBrownGov @SecDef19 https://t.co/kEVTdUYrx6

.@rameshmedia was on @democracynow to discuss why we need a digital bill of rights to examine how tech platforms make decisions on promoting content and using data.  Together we are fighting for a digital world that returns value to all of us as citizens. https://t.co/MIVLkPSanA

Don't let Trump use GDP growth as an indicator of the health of the economy.  Here are the facts: Industrial production fell in September job growth is slowing down many corporations are announcing mass layoffs and millions can't afford basic needs. https://t.co/N2pjQUbZKV

FoxConn's empty Wisconsin factories represent Trump's manufacturing policy: All smoke and mirrors.  With Trump as president manufacturing has fallen into a recession.  Americans deserve a president who will work to create good-paying jobs — not photo ops. https://t.co/kE35l9b2dw
@susandianehouc5 Thank you for that and your participation!

More than 20M people are food insecure right now. Instead of providing relief Trump wanted to cut food stamps for unemployed people in the middle of this crisis.  It’s unconscionable. We need leadership that will put the needs of Americans first. https://t.co/P7hmk7P9ik
🔁 if you can't wait one more day for a relief package.  ❤️ if you are going to vote out all the Republicans who stalled for months on helping ordinary Americans

This pandemic is continuing to spread. Millions of families can't afford enough food for their children.  Why was the Senate focused on confirming a Supreme Court justice instead of taking this emergency seriously and ending food insecurity? https://t.co/9He6eWNktX

The seven-day average of COVID-19 cases is at a record high. Trump and Republicans have no plan for:  ➡️ Nationwide testing  ➡️ Giving out masks ➡️ Distributing a vaccine equitably once available  Vote for a President and Congress that will keep your family safe.

Thank you @AdyBarkan for all of your amazing work organizing for health justice and an end to the Trump era.  You are an inspiration.  I am proud to stand by your side in the fight for Medicare for All. https://t.co/qo2pkWtIs5

For decades businesses have privatized profits while socializing risks.  The result has been inadequate funding for public programs low wages and few benefits for workers.  We need a sustainable system that supports a healthy economy. @JoanCWilliams https://t.co/lDlh7Bi53I
We are going to end the filibuster in 2021.

There is ONE WEEK until the election. We need historic voter turnout to  ✅ Defeat Trump ✅ Take back the Senate  ✅ Fight for a progressive future in 2021  If you haven't already please visit https://t.co/mB3SIIfvxR to check your voter status register or request a ballot.

Why did Republicans rush so quickly to confirm Barrett before the election?  They want to use the Supreme Court to potentially stop the vote count.  We need the highest voter turnout in history to stop them.  https://t.co/ZMUHXR6cdH

UCSF Professor Monica Gandhi shared research that mask wearing not only prevents infection but even for those who get Covid the symptoms are not as severe because masks drastically reduces inoculum. Wearing a mask is not just a social good but in a person’s self interest.

McConnell's adjournment of the Senate sends a clear message: Republicans don't care that your family has been waiting months for a relief bill.  It doesn't concern them that COVID-19 is spreading across America.  Despite so many crises their only goal was to confirm Barrett.

These are tough times but we can win this with incredible turnout.  Know your options. Make sure your vote is counted. Find voting and drop-off locations near you at https://t.co/0RAJQelsPL. https://t.co/uXt412iGH2

People shouldn't have to consider quitting their jobs because they are worried about getting sick or have to take care of their kids.  Employers should provide PPE paid sick & family leave and more flexibility for all those who juggle work & caregiving. https://t.co/g3LSaG2mNb

@ggreenwald @jawoodward And then the second order question is on the authenticity of the emails. Is it your view that the marketplace of ideas should sort out? What about deep fakes? @ryangrim @ggreenwald I agree with both of you that Twitter’s policy is over broad. I also agree that there should be deference to disseminating information of public concern. I wonder how to prevent violations of private citizens privacy or petty theft on campaigns that doesn’t have a noble purpose.

@ryangrim @ggreenwald Is there anything that can be done to prevent a culture where campaigns engage in hacking and targeting campaign staff volunteers family members? Or do you think the current criminal laws are sufficient deterrent.

@ryangrim @ggreenwald So if journalists should publish even private citizens private communications if they touch on issues of public concern then do you have any concern on the increased violations of civil liberties in the blood sport of politics?

@ryangrim @ggreenwald I appreciate both of your responses. The Court’s rulings have turned on of the public interst not the public/private status of the individuals involved in the communication. Their primary concern is the right of the public to receive such information.

The public stuff is easy and I’m in 110 percent agreement. I also believe journalists should have the right to publish even if the source content was obtained illegally. I am just genuinely struggling with what the ethical boundaries should be when a private individual.

Perhaps the answer is to make the stealing/hacking of private information a severe crime but still have dissemination if it touches on public events? But I worry whether that incentivized more watergates and the criminalization of politics.

There is clearly a distinction between private and public. But would you say any private communication by a private individual about public officials should be disseminated. Would this incentivize hacking into a person’s marital conversations breaking into their homes?

The twitter policy is over broad. The cases @ggreenwald and @ryangrim cite show the dangers. But genuinely asking on where the line is. Let’s say someone breaks into a home and steals info about a private citizen. A journalist has a right to publish but should they? https://t.co/TCx1TOR1eR

@ggreenwald The policy is over broad for sure. But genuinely curious where you would draw lines. Let’s say someone breaks into a home and steals private information from a private citizen. A journalist certainly has the right to publish it but are there ethical boundaries?
